tool.name: Exomiser v7.2.1
tool.description: A Tool to Annotate and Prioritize Exome Variants
tool.command:
exomiser.py '$vcf' '$outfile_html' '$outfile_vcf' '$outfile_tab_gene' '$outfile_tab_variant' "\${JAVA8_PATH}" "\${EXOMISER_JAR}" --out-format "HTML,VCF,TAB-GENE,TAB-VARIANT"
#if $in_opt.prioritiser: --prioritiser '${in_opt.prioritiser}' #end if #if $in_opt.inheritance_mode: --inheritance-mode '${in_opt.inheritance_mode}' #end if #if $in_opt.hpo_ids: --hpo-ids '${in_opt.hpo_ids}' #end if #if $in_opt.settings_file: --settings-file '${in_opt.settings_file}' #end if #if $in_opt.restrict_interval: --restrict-interval '${in_opt.restrict_interval}' #end if #if $in_opt.ped: --ped '${in_opt.ped}' #end if #if $in_opt.full_analysis: --full-analysis #end if
#if $out_opt.num_genes: --num-genes '${out_opt.num_genes}' #end if #if $out_opt.output_pass_variants_only: --output-pass-variants-only #end if
#if $filt.keep_off_target: --keep-off-target #end if #if $filt.keep_non_pathogenic: --keep-non-pathogenic #end if #if $filt.remove_known_variants: --remove-known-variants #end if #if $filt.max_freq: --max-freq '${filt.max_freq}' #end if #if $filt.min_qual: --min-qual '${filt.min_qual}' #end if
#if $pedigree.proband_id: --proband_id '${pedigree.proband_id}' #end if #if $pedigree.proband_sex: --proband_sex '${pedigree.proband_sex}' #end if #if $pedigree.mother_id: --mother_id '${pedigree.mother_id}' #end if #if $pedigree.father_id: --father_id '${pedigree.father_id}' #end if #if $pedigree.proband_aff: --proband_aff #end if #if $pedigree.mother_aff: --mother_aff #end if #if $pedigree.father_aff: --father_aff #end if
#if $adv.candidate_gene: --candidate-gene '${adv.candidate_gene}' #end if #if $adv.disease_id: --disease-id '${adv.disease_id}' #end if #if $adv.genes_to_keep: --genes-to-keep '${adv.genes_to_keep}' #end if #if $adv.seed_genes: --seed-genes '${adv.seed_genes}' #end if #if $adv.hiphive_params: --hiphive-params '${adv.hiphive_params}' #end if

param.name: vcf
param.label: Input VCF
param.help: Path to VCF file with mutations to be analyzed. Can be either for an individual or a family.

param.name: prioritiser
param.label: Prioritiser
param.help: Name of the prioritiser used to score the genes. http://exomiser.github.io/Exomiser/manual/7/quickstart/#prioritisers

param.name: inheritance_mode
param.label: Inheritance Mode
param.help: Filter variants for inheritance pattern (AR, AD, X)

param.name: hpo_ids
param.label: HPO IDs
param.help: Comma separated list of HPO IDs for the sample being sequenced e.g. HP:0000407,HP:0009830,HP:0002858

param.name: settings_file
param.label: Settings File
param.help: Path to settings file. Any settings specified in the file will be overidden by parameters added on the command-line.

param.name: restrict_interval
param.label: Restrict to Interval
param.help: Restrict to region/interval (e.g., 2:12345-67890)

param.name: ped
param.label: Pedigree File
param.help: Path to pedigree (ped) file. Required if the vcf file is for a family.

param.name: full_analysis
param.label: Full Analysis
param.help: Run the analysis such that all variants are run through all filters. This will take longer, but give more complete results. Default is false.

param.name: num_genes
param.label: Number of Output Genes
param.help: Number of genes to show in output

param.name: output_pass_variants_only
param.label: Output Pass Variants Only
param.help: Only write out PASS variants in TSV and VCF files.

param.name: keep_off_target
param.label: Keep Off Target Reads
param.help: Keep the off-target variants that are normally removed by default. These are defined as intergenic, intronic, upstream, downstream or intronic ncRNA variants. This setting can optionally take a true/false argument. Not including the argument is equivalent to specifying 'true'.

param.name: keep_non_pathogenic
param.label: Keep Non-Pathogenic
param.help: Keep the predicted non-pathogenic variants that are normally removed by default. These are defined as syonymous, intergenic, intronic, upstream, downstream or intronic ncRNA variants. This setting can optionally take a true/false argument. Not including the argument is equivalent to specifying 'true'.

param.name: remove_known_variants
param.label: Remove Known Variants
param.help: Filter out all variants with an entry in dbSNP/ESP/ExAC (regardless of frequency).

param.name: min_qual
param.label: Minimum Quality
param.help: Mimimum quality threshold for variants as specifed in VCF 'QUAL' column. Default: 0

param.name: max_freq
param.label: Maximum Frequency
param.help: Maximum frequency threshold for variants to be retained. e.g. 100.00 will retain all variants. Default: 100.00

param.name: proband_id
param.label: Proband ID
param.help: Sample ID for the proband data.

param.name: proband_sex
param.label: Proband Sex
param.help: Sex of proband.

param.name: mother_id
param.label: Mother ID
param.help: Sample ID for the mother data.

param.name: father_id
param.label: Father ID
param.help: Sample ID for the father data.

param.name: proband_aff
param.label: Proband Affected
param.help: Proband affected status.

param.name: mother_aff
param.label: Mother Affected
param.help: Mother affected status.

param.name: father_aff
param.label: Father Affected
param.help: Father affected status.

param.name: candidate_gene
param.label: Candidate Gene (HGNC)
param.help: Gene symbol of known or suspected gene association e.g. FGFR2

param.name: disease_id
param.label: Disease ID (OMIM)
param.help: OMIM ID for disease being sequenced. e.g. OMIM:101600

param.name: genes_to_keep
param.label: Filtered Genes (Entrez)
param.help: Comma separated list of seed genes (Entrez gene IDs) for filtering

param.name: seed_genes
param.label: Seed Genes (Entrez)
param.help: Comma separated list of seed genes (Entrez gene IDs) for random walk

param.name: hiphive_params
param.label: hiPHIVE Parameters
param.help: Comma separated list of optional parameters for hiphive: human, mouse, fish, ppi. e.g. --hiphive-params=human or --hiphive-params=human,mouse,ppi

tool.help:
The Exomiser is a Java program that finds potential disease-causing variants from whole-exome or whole-genome sequencing data.
Starting from a VCF file and a set of phenotypes encoded using the Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) it will annotate, filter and prioritise likely causative variants. The program does this based on user-defined criteria such as a variant's predicted pathogenicity, frequency of occurrence in a population and also how closely the given phenotype matches the known phenotype of diseased genes from human and model organism data.
The functional annotation of variants is handled by Jannovar and uses UCSC KnownGene transcript definitions and hg19 genomic coordinates.
Variants are prioritised according to user-defined criteria on variant frequency, pathogenicity, quality, inheritance pattern, and model organism phenotype data. Predicted pathogenicity data is extracted from the dbNSFP resource. Variant frequency data is taken from the 1000 Genomes, ESP and ExAC datasets. Subsets of these frequency and pathogenicity data can be defined to further tune the analysis. Cross-species phenotype comparisons come from our PhenoDigm tool powered by the OWLTools OWLSim algorithm.
The Exomiser was developed by the Computational Biology and Bioinformatics group at the Institute for Medical Genetics and Human Genetics of the Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin, the Mouse Informatics Group at the Sanger Institute and other members of the Monarch initiative.
